summary: This police report details the investigation into telephone calls related to a victim of Epstein. It discusses attempts to subpoena Alfredo Rodriguez, Epstein's former houseman, and analyzes call data from a victim's cellular phone. The report also mentions a private investigator, Paul A. Lavery, and his connections to other individuals involved in the case.

persons.name: Alfredo Rodriguez
persons.context: Rodriguez is mentioned as a former houseman for Epstein who had eluded process servers and was not served an investigative subpoena.

persons.name: Paul A. Lavery
persons.context: Lavery is identified as a private investigator with a criminal record, who had telephone contact related to the investigation.

persons.name: Roy Black
persons.context: Black is mentioned in connection with Lavery, indicating he is among Lavery's clientele.

connections.description: Lavery is noted to have Roy Black as one of his clients.

events.title: Victim's Calls to Epstein's Residence
events.description: The victim made several calls to Epstein's residence on February 6, 2005, shortly after an incident occurred there.

keyFacts: Alfredo Rodriguez had eluded process servers and was not served an investigative subpoena.
Paul A. Lavery is a private investigator with a criminal record for possession of cocaine and solicitation of prostitution.
The victim's cellular phone records indicate multiple calls to Epstein's residence on February 6, 2005.
Roy Black is mentioned as an attorney associated with Lavery.
The report indicates ongoing investigation and analysis of call data.
